context: In 2005, Teradata was a leading provider of enterprise data warehousing solutions and analytics platforms, then operating as a division of NCR Corporation (it became independent in 2007). The company specialized in massively parallel processing (MPP) database systems for large-scale data warehousing and business intelligence. During this period, the data warehousing market was dominated by traditional enterprise database vendors before the emergence of cloud-based analytics platforms.

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Major competitor offering Oracle Database and data warehousing solutions for enterprise analytics and business intelligence

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Significant competitor with DB2 database and data warehousing solutions, along with business intelligence tools

competitors.name: Microsoft
competitors.notes: Competitor with SQL Server database and growing presence in enterprise data warehousing and BI markets

competitors.name: Netezza
competitors.notes: Specialized data warehousing appliance competitor offering high-performance analytics platform (later acquired by IBM in 2010)

competitors.name: Greenplum
competitors.notes: Emerging MPP database competitor for data warehousing and analytics (later acquired by EMC in 2010, now part of VMware)

competitors.name: Vertica
competitors.notes: Column-store database competitor for analytics and data warehousing (founded in 2005, later acquired by HP in 2011)
